name: No Bake Vegan Snickerdoodle Bites
description: These healthy 6 ingredient vegan snickerdoodle bites taste just like a holiday cookie but are actually good for you. Glutenfree. The perfect easy and kid-friendly snack that tastes like cinnamon sugar cookie!

video.name: NO BAKE VEGAN SNICKERDOODLE BITES | 6 Ingredient Energy Balls | Vegan Richa Recipes
video.description:
Vegan snickerdoodle bites 6 ingredients!

Get the WRITTEN RECIPE here - https://www.veganricha.com/vegan-snickerdoodle-bites/

SUBSCRIBE HERE: https://www.youtube.com/veganricharecipes?sub_confirmation=1

These Easy vegan snickerdoodle bites taste just like a holiday cookie but are actually good for you. Just 6 ingredients and 10 mins.  The perfect easy and kid-friendly snack for anyone in need for some energy on-the-go! Grain-free option included. 

These Vegan Snickerdoodle Energy Bites are the perfect thing to have on hand anytime. But especially around fall and winter when you’re really craving a holiday cookie but don’t actually want to deal with 1, baking and 2, all the cookie-snacking consequences (hello sugar coma). Because these simple vegan snacks are made from wholesome plant-based ingredients only – no added refined sugar, gluten, or oil– they are a festive treat I’m happy to enjoy anytime and kids love them too.

******MORE ENERGY BITES FROM THE BLOG******

BLUEBERRY MUFFIN ENERGY BITES: https://www.veganricha.com/blueberry-muffin-energy-bites-vegan/

recipeIngredient: 2 tbsp smooth almond butter (or use peanut butter(it has stronger flavor) )
1/2 cup oat flour  (or 3 tbsp coconut flour to keep it grain free)
1 tbsp cane sugar or coconut sugar  ((optional but great for texture ))

recipeInstructions.text: Warm the maple syrup(in a saucepan or microwave) and add to a bowl. mix in the almond butter and maple syrup until well combined.
recipeInstructions.name: Warm the maple syrup(in a saucepan or microwave) and add to a bowl. mix in the almond butter and maple syrup until well combined.

recipeInstructions.text: Add in the rest of the ingredients mix with a spatula to turn everthing into a dough. It will take a minute to come together. If the mixture is too dry, add more maple syrup 1 tsp at a time
recipeInstructions.name: Add in the rest of the ingredients mix with a spatula to turn everthing into a dough. It will take a minute to come together. If the mixture is too dry, add more maple syrup 1 tsp at a time

recipeInstructions.text: In another small bowl, mix the cinnamon and sugar for coating.
recipeInstructions.name: In another small bowl, mix the cinnamon and sugar for coating.

recipeInstructions.text: Take small balls out of the dough using a teaspoon and roll into a ball, then roll the ball in the cinnamon sugar mixture
recipeInstructions.name: Take small balls out of the dough using a teaspoon and roll into a ball, then roll the ball in the cinnamon sugar mixture

recipeInstructions.text: Repeat for all of the remaining dough. Store on the counter for upto 2 days or refrigerate for upto 2-3 weeks
recipeInstructions.name: Repeat for all of the remaining dough. Store on the counter for upto 2 days or refrigerate for upto 2-3 weeks

keywords: Snickerdoodle energy bites, vegan bliss balls, vegan energy bites
